alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Brown; Cherry; Custer; Garfield; Holt; Loup; Rock; Thomas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 24 at 1:21AM CDT until June 24 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Cherry County in north central Nebraska... Southern Rock County in north central Nebraska... Loup County in north central Nebraska... Southern Brown County in north central Nebraska... Garfield County in north central Nebraska... Southwestern Holt County in north central Nebraska... Northeastern Custer County in central Nebraska... Blaine County in north central Nebraska... Northeastern Thomas County in north central Nebraska... * Until 200 AM CDT. * At 120 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles east of Elsmere to near Brewster to 8 miles northeast of Victoria Springs State Recreation Area to near Merna, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 109 AM CDT, a 66 mph gust was reported 1 mile south of Dunning. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Burwell, Taylor, Brewster, Sargent, Anselmo, Dunning, Comstock, Purdum, Rose, Amelia, Victoria Springs State Recreation Area, Calamus Reservoir State Recreation Area, Elsmere, Lillian, Milburn, Milburn Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Hofeld Lake, Fox Bayou, Raven and Almeria Meadow State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 106 and 173. Highway 2 between mile markers 255 and 267. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for north central Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for north central Nebraska.
